lead_paragraph: More than 250 judges attended anti-bias training in August as part of a Justice Department initiative to reduce bias in deportation proceedings.

headline.print_headline: Immigration Judges Face Up to Their Prejudices
headline.main: How U.S. Immigration Judges Battle Their Own Prejudice

snippet: More than 250 judges attended anti-bias training in August as part of a Justice Department initiative to reduce bias in deportation proceedings....
abstract: Justice Dept's large force of federal Immigration judges contend not only with enormous backlog of cases, but with their own personal biases and complications of cultural and linguistic misunderstandings; in attempting to ameloriate role of bias in law enforcement and courts, DOJ is requiring thousands of federal employees, including initial bloc of 250 federal immigration judges, to  take part in mandatory anti-bias training.
